content.description: Wander up the face on juggy holds eventually trending leftward following the path of least resistance toward a good size pine growing on an ample ledge then follow the ridge to the summit.
content.location: Start uphill of the large, barkless ponderosa growing tight up against the formation.

content.description:
Start in chimney formed by detached giant flake.  There is a bolt at the stance on top of the flake.  Move right then up easy face to hanging 2-bolt belay.  Chickenhead hike to top, belaying off tree*.  EFR doesn't give any stars, but the wannabe alpinist in me likes the idea of a summit, so I like this route.  Fun and easy. 

   *Check that, apparently the tree has gone AWOL.
content.protection: A few nuts and cams are good, slings for chickenheads, draws for one bolt and belay.  Easy climbing, so expect to run it out.
content.location: Begins in obvious alcove/chimney formed by big flake at left end of the west side (closest to road).  Descent: Walk off to the north (away from face and left) and you will find a good tree with rap slings.  Drop down into gully here on a short rap then walk off north and west.

content.description:
Start about 75 feet up and left of Standard Route. This spot is at the top of a short gully and at the base of a left-leaning, left-facing corner (the line of Easy Lay [5.6]).

 Go up the left-facing corner about 10 feet (as for Easy Lay) then step right and go up the steep face past three bolts to the arête. Step right around the arête onto the lower angled face and go up past two more bolts to an anchor.

 Lower or rappel with one 60m rope.
content.protection: Five bolts, a gold and a blue Camalot  and a shoulder length sling or two. Anchor on top.
content.location: Start about 75 feet up and left of Standard Route. This spot is at the top of a short gully and at the base of a left-leaning, left-facing corner (the line of Easy Lay [5.6]).

content.description: This is the left-most of three bolted routes.  Start under the roof on questionable rock.  Pull through sharp holds and powerful moves past the first bolt.  Don't fall here.  Continue on better rock to fun face and slab climbing above.
content.protection: Quickdraws.  Bolts to three cold shuts at the top.
content.location: The left-most of three steep, bolted sport routes.

content.description: Climb up a couple unprotected moves to reach a left-facing corner. Climb the corner to the top, then go up and right onto the face. Climb the easy face to the top of the formation.
content.protection: Carry medium to large gear to protect the corner.
content.location: Start in the same spot as Hornli, about 40 feet up and left of Standard Route. This spot is at the base of a left-facing corner.

content.protection: Small Cams and Nuts. 2 bolt belay shared with the Standard Route.
content.location: Steep Groove right of the "Standard Route."

content.description: Bag an easy summit on this cute miniature mountain.  Three newer routes are bolted up the steep face right of the Standard Route, but I'm not sure what there are rated.  Each pulls over the big roof at the second bolts and goes up an easier-looking face.  5.10, 5.11?  The rock is somewhat questionable under the overhang.  Good bouldering is nearby on Matterhorn boulder, just to the south.
